intro: Blephariglottis psycodes f. rosea, commonly known as the pink-flowered bellflower, is a striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range from pale pink to deep rose hues. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
